decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, and then bringing them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Exhume. The deck aims to cheat these creatures into play at a low cost, often as early as the first couple of turns, catching the opponent off guard with powerful threats that can quickly turn the game in the player's favor. The deck also includes disruption elements such as Thoughtseize and Unmask to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on cheating big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. It also has protection with cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer. The deck aims to ramp up with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Eureka to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. The inclusion of Ice-Fang Coatl provides additional card draw and defense. The overall strategy is to quickly put out massive threats and outpace the opponent before they can react effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own threats. It aims to control the pace of the game with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while using versatile removal like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to handle opposing threats. The deck also utilizes the synergy between snow lands and Ice-Fang Coatl to generate card advantage and board presence. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a grindy game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats to apply pressure. It utilizes disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, as well as versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to further enhance its creatures. With a strong mix of disruption, efficient creatures, and equipment, this deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-generating artifacts in order to cast a high number of spells in a single turn. By combining cantrips like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Preordain with cards that allow for duplicate casting like Past in Flames and Aeve, Progenitor Ooze, the deck sets up for a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Peer into the Abyss to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures and equipment. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays and limit their options. At the same time, cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp help to provide additional threats and value. With access to powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and disruptive lands like Wasteland, the deck aims to control the game and come out on top through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents while maintaining aggressive pressure. It utilizes efficient spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to control the board and protect its threats. Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent provide consistent damage, while Sedgemoor Witch generates value and tokens. The deck also includes tempo plays like Daze and Lightning Bolt to keep opponents on the back foot. By combining disruption, aggression, and resource denial, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and control the game tempo.

The main concept of this Combo - Painter deck is to create a lock on the opponent by using Painter's Servant to change all cards in the opponent's deck to a specific color, then activating Grindstone to mill their entire library in one turn. With cards like Imperial Recruiter, Goblin Welder, and Goblin Engineer to tutor and assemble the combo pieces, supplemented by disruptive cards like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge for protection, this deck aims to execute its combo quickly and efficiently while controlling the opponent's board state.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifacts and leveraging them to generate explosive amounts of mana and/or massive creature threats. By using cards like Mox Opal, Urza's Saga, and Springleaf Drum, the deck can power out threats like Nettlecyst, Arcbound Ravager, and Walking Ballista at a rapid pace. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive threats and mana acceleration, leading to quick victories.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing mana denial through cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, along with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, the deck aims to slow down the opponent and control the board. Additionally, the deck has a strong equipment package with cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, providing additional sources of damage and resilience. The deck's synergy and versatility allow it to adapt to different matchups and strategies effectively.

This deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while also utilizing creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger to combo off with Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to draw through the deck quickly. The end goal is to set up a big Craterhoof Behemoth or Archon of Valor's Reach to win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Allosaurus Shepherd and Collector Ouphe to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly by utilizing cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, which allows the player to cast powerful creature spells such as Craterhoof Behemoth. The key strategy involves using creatures with abilities that untap lands, like Quirion Ranger and Wirewood Symbiote, to generate even more mana and fuel explosive turns. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Elves and finish the game by casting powerful spells like Natural Order to bring out game-changing creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of countermagic, hand disruption, and removal spells. It aims to control the game through card advantage and efficient removal, while creating pressure with evasive threats like True-Name Nemesis and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also includes versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant to handle a variety of situations. The mana base is optimized for casting the deck's spells efficiently, with a focus on fetching the necessary colors of mana when needed.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Infect deck is to quickly build up infect counters on opponents using efficient creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while also protecting them with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense. The deck aims to end the game swiftly through the use of pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk. The deck also includes a strong counter package with Force of Will and Daze, along with card selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in executing the infect strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain board control by countering or removing threats from the opponent while also maintaining card advantage through spells like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The inclusion of Counterbalance and Back to Basics helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and slow down their mana development. Additionally, the deck utilizes planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to further control the game and restrict the opponent's options.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive threats early on, such as Delver of Secrets and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to finish off opponents quickly. With a mix of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and burn, this UR Aggro deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the start and maintain tempo throughout the game.
